bestBHT.bht: The heart is the laboratory and the fountain-head of all that is good and bad in the inner life of man. Evil thoughts, resembling the crimes in a modern police court, originate from the heart and lead to a dreadful list, including adultery, fornication, and murder. Pride, seen in a haughty and stuck-up attitude, is also among these evils. This text warns that the inward part of man is wicked and full of evil, making it impossible for anything good to naturally come out of such a heart.

Henry Alford: The heart is the laboratory and the fountain-head of all that is good and bad in the inner life of man.
St. Matthew’s catalogue follows the order of the second table of the decalogue.’ St. Mark’s more copious one varies the order.
Our Lord’s retirement was to avoid the Pharisees.
Marvin Vincent: The word dialogismoi, thoughts, does not in itself convey a bad sense.
Radically, it carries the idea of discussion or debate, with an under-thought of suspicion or doubt.
Philip Schaff: The heart of man is the laboratory and fountain-head of all that is good and bad in the inner life of man.
The body is the seat of sin is here denied.
Mark’s catalogue of sins is fuller than that of Matthew, indicating that the sins are common and notorious.
Archibald T. Robertson: Evil thoughts... come out of the heart... and lead to the dreadful list here given like the crimes of a modern police court."
Evil eye... haunts one with its gloating stare.
Pride... holding oneself above others, stuck up.
John Gill: The inside of man is very bad, his inward part is not only wicked, but wickedness itself.
In him dwells no good thing naturally, his heart is wicked, and desperately so; it is full of evil.
What good thing therefore, can come out of such a Nazareth as this? Nothing, but what follows: for from hence proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders.

bhtAttempts.bht: The heart is the laboratory and the fountain-head of all that is good and bad in the inner life of man. Our Lord's retirement was to avoid the Pharisees and the sins listed by St. Mark vary the order from that of St. Matthew. Evil thoughts come out of the heart and lead to a dreadful list of crimes, like those seen in a modern police court, such as adultery, fornication, and murder. Pride, manifested in one's haughty and stuck-up attitude, is also among these evils. Ultimately, the verse warns us that the inward part of man is not only wicked, but wickedness itself, revealing that no good thing can naturally come out of a heart filled with such evil.

The heart is the laboratory and the fountain-head of all that is good and bad in the inner life of man. Evil thoughts come out of the heart and lead to a dreadful list here given like the crimes of a modern police court. Pride, manifested in one's haughty and stuck-up attitude, is among these evils. The verse warns that the inward part of man is wicked, and desperately so; it is full of evil. No good thing can naturally come out of such a heart.

Pride, manifested in a haughty and stuck-up attitude, is another evil. The verse warns that the inward part of man is wicked, and desperately so; it is full of evil. No good thing can naturally come out of such a heart.
